item.title: Baby John Box Office Day 2 (Early Trends): Suffers Over 55% Drop Post Christmas, Varun Dhawan’s Film Is In Alarming Situation! - Koimoi
item.description:
Baby John Box Office Day 2 (Early Trends): Suffers Over 55% Drop Post Christmas, Varun Dhawan’s Film Is

Publication Date: December 26, 2024

Source: Koimoi

The action thriller Baby John, led by Varun Dhawan, faced a disappointing downturn in box office collections after a promising opening. Despite expectations, the film struggled against competition and mixed reviews.

Key Points:

  • Day 1 box office: 11.25 crores
  • Day 2 early estimates: 4-5 crores
  • Overall collection for two days: 15.25-16.25 crores
  • Film’s release coincided with the successful Pushpa 2
  • Daily drop in revenue between 55-64% indicating poor audience reception
"The mixed word-of-mouth is visibly impacting the footfall, and the film will soon crash if it does not maintain its hold tomorrow."

Overall, Baby John has not met the expected box office performance, raising concerns for its future runs amidst stiff competition.

item.title: Breakthrough sunscreen protects and cools your skin simultaneously: All you want to know - The Times of India
item.description:
Breakthrough sunscreen protects and cools your skin simultaneously: All you want to know

Publication Date: N/A Source: Times of India

This article discusses a revolutionary sunscreen that not only protects the skin from harmful UV rays but also provides a cooling effect, enhancing the overall skincare experience.

  • The new sunscreen uses advanced technology.
  • It contains ingredients that offer hydration and skin cooling.
  • The product is aimed at consumers who spend extended time outdoors.
"This is a game-changer for summer skincare routines."

The innovation in sunscreen technology promises to change the way consumers protect and care for their skin during sunny conditions.

item.title: Lakshya and Pashmina Roshan to Laapataa Ladies Pratibha Ranta-Nitanshi Goel: 7 Bollywood debuts we witnessed in 2024 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bollywood Introduces New Talent: 2024 Debuts

Date: Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

As 2024 comes to an end, Bollywood has welcomed several new talents who made their debut this year, bringing fresh energy and excitement to the industry.

  • Lakshya: Debuted with a blockbuster hit, Kill, showcasing an impactful performance.
  • Junaid Khan: Son of Aamir Khan, impressed with his work in Maharaj, exceeding high expectations.
  • Pashmina Roshan: Made her debut in Ishq Vishk Rebound, leaving audiences intrigued with her promise.
  • Jibraan Khan: Returned to lead role in Ishq Vishk Rebound, winning hearts with charismatic performances.
  • Abhay Verma: Stole the show in Munjya, receiving praise for his performance and chemistry with co-star.
  • Pratibha Ranta: Starred in Laapataa Ladies, portraying a character that inspires audiences to find themselves.
  • Nitanshi Goel: Also in Laapataa Ladies, her performance resonated deeply with viewers.

These new actors have shown great potential, making fans excited about their future endeavors.

item.title: 'Sachin Tendulkar always answered with his bat': Basit Ali slams Virat Kohli after Sam Konstas altercatio - The Times of India
item.description:
'Sachin Tendulkar always answered with his bat': Basit Ali criticizes Virat Kohli after altercation with Sam Konstas

Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Former cricketer Basit Ali has spoken out against Virat Kohli following a recent incident during the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground where Kohli collided with Australian player Sam Konstas.

  • The altercation occurred as Kohli was frustrated with Konstas’ performance.
  • Basit Ali criticized Kohli's actions, stating he seems guilty of inappropriate behavior.
  • He compared Kohli’s actions unfavorably to Sachin Tendulkar’s past conduct in similar situations.
  • The ICC fined Kohli 20% of his match fee and issued a demerit point for the incident.
  • The incident has sparked debate about discipline in cricket and the fairness of penalties for high-profile players.
“It’s really disheartening to see this controversy... Virat Kohli is guilty.”

The discussion surrounding Kohli’s actions highlights ongoing concerns about player behavior and the enforcement of disciplinary measures in professional cricket.

item.title: Which infectious disease is likely to be biggest emerging problem in 2025? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Which infectious disease is likely to be biggest emerging problem in 2025?

Publication Date: N/A | Source: Indian Express

The article discusses concerns among public health officials regarding emerging infectious diseases, particularly as COVID-19 recedes. It highlights the potential threat posed by the H5N1 influenza virus and compares it with ongoing threats such as malaria, HIV, and tuberculosis.

  • COVID-19 has raised awareness of the potential for new infectious diseases.
  • Malaria, HIV, and tuberculosis currently kill around 2 million people annually.
  • H5N1 bird flu is spreading among birds and recently infecting cattle in the US.
  • There has been a significant increase in human bird flu cases in 2023.
  • H5N1 has a high mortality rate in humans but does not currently spread between people.
  • A mutation could potentially enable human-to-human transmission of H5N1.
  • Governments are preparing for the possibility of a pandemic by acquiring vaccines and planning responses.
If this strain of bird flu makes that switch and can start transmitting between humans, governments must act quickly to control the spread.

The article concludes that while H5N1 poses a potential threat, existing diseases must also be prioritized in public health initiatives.

item.title: Pushpa 2 Box Office collection Day 22: Allu Arjun blockbuster unstoppable, bags over ₹9 crore | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection Day 22

Publication Date: December 27, 2023 | Source: Live Mint

‘Pushpa 2: The Rule’ has continued to dominate the box office, earning ₹7 crore on Day 22, with total collections nearing ₹1500 crore.

  • The total collection of the movie reached ₹1119.2 crore net.
  • The Telugu version grossed the highest at ₹22.72 crore.
  • The Hindi version accumulated ₹102.3 crores.
  • Day 22 occupancy was highest in Chennai, with 48% in theatres.
  • On Christmas, the movie earned nearly ₹20 crore at the box office.
  • An AI-generated video featuring the lead stars has gone viral, gaining over 389,000 views.
“The viral video has quickly gained attention online.”

In conclusion, 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' is set to break more records as it continues its successful run in theatres.

item.title: Baby John box office collection day 2: Varun Dhawan film sees sharp decline; makes around ₹3.9 crore - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Baby John box office collection day 2: The film narrates the gripping story of a cop who assumes a new identity to provide a safe haven for his daughter.

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Varun Dhawan-starrer had a promising start, registering double-digit opening day numbers. However, the film's momentum was short-lived, as it experienced a significant dip at the box office on its second day.

Key Points:

  • The film registered a business of around ₹3.9 crore (nett) in India on day 2.
  • It had an opening day collection of ₹11.25 crore.
  • Total collection in India stands at ₹15.17 crore (nett) after two days.
  • The film had an overall 9.39 percent occupancy on its second day.
  • Footfall varied significantly throughout the day with morning shows at 5.85 percent and evening shows at 11.09 percent.

Notable Quotes:

“There’s no sense of direction, and the cute girl bossing around her dad has no effect.” - Hindustan Times Review

Conclusion:

Despite a strong start, Baby John faces challenges as it enters a critical phase in its box office journey, reflecting the fluctuating dynamics of audience reception in Bollywood.

item.title: How Allu Arjun's arrest over fan death turned into a political slugfest - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Allu Arjun's Arrest Over Fan Death Sparks Political Controversy

Publication Date: December 5, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Allu Arjun's attendance at the screening of his film 'Pushpa 2' resulted in a tragic stampede at Sandhya Theatre, leading to his arrest and subsequent political fallout.

  • A stampede occurred on December 4, resulting in the death of a 35-year-old woman and critical injuries to her son.
  • Allu Arjun was charged with culpable homicide not amounting to murder but has since been released on bail.
  • The incident triggered political exchanges, particularly involving Telangana's CM Revanth Reddy who accused the actor of negligence.
  • Allu Arjun donated ₹2 crore to the victim’s family amidst claims of political motivation behind the accusations against him.
  • Political analysts suggest this controversy may be aimed at diminishing Allu Arjun's influence due to his connections with the BJP.
“An actor cannot be perceived as a criminal because an accident happens.”

The event drew widespread media attention, revealing the intersection of film and politics in India, particularly how a star's misfortune can become a platform for political maneuvering.

item.title: Former prime minister Dr Manmohan Singh admitted to AIIMS - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Dr. Manmohan Singh Admitted to AIIMS Amid Health Concerns

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Former prime minister Dr. Manmohan Singh was admitted to the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in critical condition on Thursday evening.

  • Dr. Singh, aged 92, was admitted around 8 PM.
  • Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra visited to check on his health.
  • Ashok Gehlot expressed concern over Dr. Singh’s health on social media.
  • Singh served as prime minister from 2004 to 2014 and retired from the Rajya Sabha earlier this year.
“Unemployment is high and the informal sector is in shambles, a crisis precipitated by the ill-considered demonetisation decision taken in 2016.” - Dr. Manmohan Singh

Dr. Singh has had a long career in economics and governance, holding multiple significant positions in the Indian government.

item.title: Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue booked 175.31x led by QIBs & NIIs. Check GMP, review | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue booked 175.31x led by QIBs & NIIs. Check GMP, review

Publication Date: 26 Dec, 2024 8:32:55 AM
Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

Unimech Aerospace has concluded its IPO with significant oversubscription, registering a total of 175.31 times as the bidding period closes. The offer includes up to ₹250 crore in fresh issues and an equal amount in offer-for-sale (OFS), priced between ₹745-785 per share.

  • The Qualified Institutional Buyer (QIB) portion saw an oversubscription of 317.63 times.
  • The Non-Institutional Investor (NII) segment was subscribed 263.40 times.
  • The retail section received 56.74 times the number of bids submitted.
“We recommend a ‘SUBSCRIBE’ rating for this issue given its strong growth potential and market position.”

The grey market premium (GMP) indicates a potential listing gain of approximately 80% over the IPO price.

item.title: Stanford Researchers Create Virtual Lab with AI Scientists to Automate Scientific Discovery - INDIAai
item.description:
Stanford Researchers Create Virtual Lab with AI Scientists to Automate Scientific Discovery

Publication Date: Recently

Source: Stanford University

The researchers at Stanford University have developed a groundbreaking virtual lab that utilizes AI scientists to automate scientific discovery, specifically in the design of nanobodies targeting COVID-19.

This innovation leads to significant advancements in research speed and efficiency. Key points include:

  • The virtual lab includes AI agents working autonomously on scientific problems.
  • The system designed 92 nanobodies, with over 90% success in binding the SARS-CoV-2 variant.
  • Human oversight remains crucial to validate AI-generated hypotheses.
“These virtual-lab AI agents have shown to be quite capable at doing a lot of tasks,” - James Zou, Computational Biologist.

The findings highlight the collaborative potential of AI in research while emphasizing the need for human intervention to ensure accuracy and reliability.

item.title: Empowering Indian Gamers: Zupee's vision for a homegrown gaming platform - India TV News
item.description:
Empowering Indian Gamers: Zupee's Vision for a Homegrown Gaming Platform

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India TV News

The article discusses how Zupee is transforming traditional Indian games into a modern digital platform that caters to a diverse audience while promoting Indian culture.

  • Zupee revitalizes traditional Indian games by making them accessible in interactive, digital formats.
  • The platform focuses on skill-based gaming, removing chance elements and encouraging strategic gameplay.
  • Zupee aims for inclusivity, attracting players of varying skill levels, including those from tier 2 and 3 cities.
  • By promoting games deeply rooted in Indian culture, Zupee enhances cultural awareness among millions of users.
  • Committed to responsible gaming, Zupee utilizes RNG certification and blockchain technology to ensure fair play.
  • With over 100 million registered users, Zupee is a leading platform in India’s skill-based gaming sector.
Zupee stands as a shining example of how technology can be harnessed to celebrate and preserve Indian cultural traditions while creating new and exciting entertainment experiences for the digital age.

Zupee is not just reshaping the gaming landscape; it's fostering a community that blends cultural heritage with modern gaming thrills, offering a unique experience for Indian gamers.

item.title: Pushpa 2 (Hindi) Week 3 Box Office: Allu Arjun starrer earns Rs 662 crore in 22 days; Racing towards Rs 700 crore club - PINKVILLA
item.description:
Pushpa 2 (Hindi) Week 3 Box Office: Allu Arjun starrer earns Rs 662 crore in 22 days

Published on Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Pinkvilla

Pushpa 2: The Rule has made a significant impact at the box office, bringing in Rs 662.50 crore in just 22 days. The film is directed by Sukumar and stars Allu Arjun, Rashmika Madanna, and Fahadh Faasil.

  • The film grossed Rs 389 crore in its first week.
  • It earned Rs 178 crore in the second week.
  • In the third week, it collected Rs 95.50 crore.
  • Pushpa 2 is on track to join the Rs 700 crore club.
  • It has shattered box office records and is expected to be a major hit during the holiday season.
“It’s an All Time Blockbuster, and the biggest in the post-pandemic world by a margin.”

Pushpa 2 has solidified Allu Arjun's stature in Hindi cinema and could lead to his becoming a leading name in North Indian films.

item.title: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani's take on work-life balance says, ‘you do things which…’ | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Gautam Adani Shares Views on Work-Life Balance

Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: ANI

In a recent statement, Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani emphasized the significance of personal happiness in achieving a proper work-life balance during an interaction.

  • Adani stated that individuals should engage in activities they enjoy to maintain a balanced lifestyle.
  • He cautioned against imposing one's work-life balance philosophy on others.
  • Adani also addressed the necessity of infrastructure development and the Adani Group's contributions compared to larger firms.
  • During Thursday’s trading session, shares of Adani Enterprises Ltd rose by 1.23%.
“Your work-life is balanced when you do things which you like doing.” — Gautam Adani

“On infrastructure, the companies which are bigger than the Adani group, they are not doing even 25% work (on infrastructure), which Adani is doing...” — Gautam Adani

This dialogue underlines the importance of individualized work-life strategies and recognizes significant contributions made by the Adani Group to infrastructure in India.

item.title: Former PM Manmohan Singh admitted to hospital, condition critical - The Hindu
item.description:
Former PM Manmohan Singh admitted to AIIMS hospital

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: PTI

Former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh, 92, has been admitted to the emergency department of All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Delhi, on Thursday (December 26, 2024).

  • He is currently in the emergency department of AIIMS.
  • The hospital has not yet released any details about his health status.
(More details awaited)

This admission raises concerns among supporters and the public regarding the health of the former leader.

item.title: Union Budget 2025: Modi govt mulls cutting income tax for individuals earning upto Rs 15 lakhs per annum - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Union Budget 2025: Modi govt mulls cutting income tax for individuals earning upto Rs 15 lakhs per annum

Published on: 26 December 2024, 15:20 IST

The Narendra Modi government is evaluating a proposal to reduce income tax for individuals earning up to Rs 15 lakhs per annum in the upcoming budget to alleviate the financial burden on the middle class amid a slowing economy.

  • The tax cut could aid millions of taxpayers, especially in urban areas, who face high living costs.
  • There are two tax systems: a traditional one with exemptions and a newer one introduced in 2020 with lower rates but no major exemptions.
  • The government has yet to determine the specific size of the tax cuts, with a decision expected before February 1.
  • Higher disposable income could stimulate demand in an economy currently experiencing sluggish growth.
  • The proposal comes amidst growing political pressure from the middle class regarding high taxes alongside stagnant wage growth.
“More money in the hands of the middle class might help rev up the economy.”

item.title: ‘Sikandar’: Makers reveal 'classy' first look poster of Salman Khan; netizens say, 'all Bollywood shocked - TOI Etimes
item.description:
‘Sikandar’: Makers reveal 'classy' first look poster of Salman Khan

Publication Date: December 26, 2023 | Source: Times of India

The long-awaited first look of Salman Khan’s new movie ‘Sikandar’ has been unveiled, creating a buzz online. Directed by A.R. Murugadoss, the poster features Salman in a powerful pose, generating excitement among fans.

  • Directed by A.R. Murugadoss.
  • Salman Khan is seen in a black formal suit holding a sharp-edged weapon.
  • The poster signifies a gripping cinematic experience.
  • Sikandar marks a reunion with producer Sajid Nadiadwala after their blockbuster 'Kick'.
  • Fans expressed their excitement on social media, calling it a major comeback.
“#The biggest comeback of Indian cinema #Salman Khan🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥”

The revealing poster sets high expectations for the movie, and fans eagerly look forward to Salman’s return to the big screen.

item.title: Shubman Gill dropped for second spinner in MCG Test - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Shubman Gill Dropped for Second Spinner in MCG Test

Date: Dec 26, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian cricket team made a surprising decision to drop Shubman Gill from the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground to include Washington Sundar as a second spinner, leading to questions about the team's batting depth.

  • Shubman Gill was not seen during team warm-ups and left the field early before the toss.
  • The team opted for a bowling attack featuring six bowlers instead of utilizing Gill's batting skills.
  • Assistant coach Abhishek Nayar explained that the decision was based on pitch conditions and the need for variation in their bowling attack.
  • Nayar acknowledged the impact of such decisions on young players like Gill, who are eager to prove themselves.
  • Gill's away record has been underwhelming, but he has been working hard in practice, indicating potential for future opportunities.
“I think a lot of the decisions when they are made and the process of it being made, the communication is always there and transparency is there.” - Abhishek Nayar

This decision raises questions about the balance between batting and bowling in the team and how it may affect future matches.

item.title: Former India player holds Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj responsible for Sam Konstas' aggressive fifty in the Boxing Day Test - Crictoday
item.description:
Irfan Pathan Critiques Bumrah and Siraj for Sam Konstas' Aggressive Fifty

Publication Date: December 26, 2024
Source: Crictoday

Former all-rounder Irfan Pathan criticized Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj for their performance in the Boxing Day Test, allowing debutant Sam Konstas to score a solid fifty.

  • Sam Konstas, a 19-year-old debutant, scored 60 runs off 65 balls, including six boundaries.
  • He formed an 89-run partnership with Usman Khawaja.
  • Pathan believes the Indian bowlers failed to pitch the ball correctly, allowing Konstas to settle down.
  • Konstas was involved in a controversial moment with Virat Kohli during the match.
  • He replaced Nathan McSweeney for the last two Tests of the series.
“Sam Konstas is an LBW candidate but the Indian bowlers didn’t try to pitch the ball up and force him to drive the ball... By the time they corrected their mistake, Sam Konstas was up and running.” - Irfan Pathan

The criticism from Pathan highlights the challenges faced by the Indian bowlers in adapting to the conditions and the implications for their performance in the series.
